paper_title: Facile construction of g-C3N4-W18O49 heterojunction with improved charge transfer for solar-driven CO2 photoreduction

catalyst.source: In this work, g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite material was constructed by a simple solvothermal method.The W 18 O 49 nanorods have a good dispersion by coupling with the g-C 3 N 4 sheet.Under simulated sunlight irradiation, the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite exhibited superior photocatalytic CO 2 reduction capability than that of g-C 3 N 4 and W 18 O 49 .
catalyst.context: Photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 into fuels is a promising approach to address the energy crisis and global warming issues.In this work, g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite material was constructed by a simple solvothermal method.The W 18 O 49 nanorods have a good dispersion by coupling with the g-C 3 N 4 sheet.Under simulated sunlight irradiation, the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite exhibited superior photocatalytic CO 2 reduction capability than that of g-C 3 N 4 and W 18 O 49 .The photo/electrochemical measurements demonstrated that the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 heterojunction could accelerate the separation and migration of charge carries, thus improving the activity of photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 into CH 4 and CO.

catalyst.source: The photocatalytic capability of the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite was evaluated by solar-driven CO 2 photoreduction.
catalyst.context: In summary, g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposites was prepared by a simple solvothermal method.It was found that the g-C 3 N 4 sheets could improve the dispersity of the W 18 O 49 and both of them have a good contact.The photocatalytic capability of the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite was evaluated by solar-driven CO 2 photoreduction.The nanocomposite exhibited superior photoreduction performance than that of g-C 3 N 4 sheets and W 18 O 49 nanorods.The photo/electrochemical measurement suggested the formed g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 heterojunction facilitate the photoinduced charge separation and migration, resulting in its enhanced activity. lamp.source: After the reactor was sealed, a 300 W xenon lamp (CEL-HXF300, CEAULIGHT Beijing) was turned on.
lamp.context: All the reagents were analytical grade and used without further purification.Tungsten hexachloride (WCl 6 ) was purchased from Aladdin in China.Urea and ethanol were purchased from Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd. in China. g-C 3 N 4 was obtained by simple calcination.20 g urea was put into a crucible, and then calcined at 550 C in a muff furnace for 3 h with heating rate was 10 C/min.In a typical synthesis of g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite, 017 g WCl 6 was first dissolved into 30 mL of anhydrous ethanol by ultrasonication.Then, 50 mg of prepared g-C 3 N 4 was added into the solution and sonicated to obtain homogeneous solution.After that, the above solution was transferred to 50 mL Teflon-lined autoclave and maintained at 200 C for 12 h.After cooling down to room temperature, the product was collected and washed several times with deionized water and anhydrous ethanol by centrifuge.The final product was dried at 60 C in vacuum overnight.Pure W 18 O 49 was prepared by the same method without the addition of g-C 3 N 4 . The as-prepared materials were characterized by different means.Xray diffraction (XRD) was tested on an X-ray diffractometer (Shimadzu XRD-6000) using Cu K radiation at a diffraction angle of 10-80 with a scanning rate of 30 /min.X-ray energy spectrum (XPS) was performed on AN X-ray energy spectrometer (VG Multilab200) using Al K (1486.6 eV) as the radiation source and the binding energy was corrected by the C1s photoelectron peak (284.6 eV).The scanning electron microscopy (SEM) image was carried out field emission electron microscope (JEOL JSM-5500LV) with the acceleration voltage of 2 kV.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectrometer (UV-DRS, Shimadzu UV-2550) was used to measure the UV-vis reflectance spectra of the prepared materials.Photoluminescence spectra (PL) were recorded with a fluorescence spectrophotometer (HITACHI F4600).Photocurrent (PC) and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) were measured on an electrochemical workstation (CHI760E) using a standard three-electrode system, in which the Pt wire, the saturated calomel electrode and the photocatalyst were used as the counter electrode, the reference electrode and the working electrode, respectively.Photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 was performed in a quartz reactor with a volume of 200 mL.In a typical photocatalysis test, 50 mg catalyst was dispersed in 1 mL deionized water under sonication, and then transferred into a glass petri dish with a diameter of 3.5 cm, which was placed at the bottom of the reactor.Before irradiation, 10 mL water was put into the bottom of the reactor and high purity CO 2 was injected to the reactor for 0.5 h.Then seal the reactor.After the reactor was sealed, a 300 W xenon lamp (CEL-HXF300, CEAULIGHT Beijing) was turned on. 1 mL of the gas products were collected after ever 1 h of irradiation and analyzed on a gas chromatography (GC-7900, CEAULIGHT Beijing) equipped with FID detector.All the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction experiments were carried out at room temperature and atmospheric pressure.

lamp.source: The photocatalytic performances of the as-prepared materials were evaluated through photocatalytic CO 2 reduction in the presence of H 2 O vapor under 300 W xenon lamp light irradiation.
lamp.context: Fig. 1a shows the synthesis diagram of the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 composite.The synthetic process contained the preparation of g-C 3 N 4 by calcination treatment of urea and subsequently hybridizing with W 18 O 49 nanorods formed in the ethanol by the solvothermal treatment.Fig. 1b-1d show the XRD patterns of the as-synthesized materials.As shown in Fig. 1b, two peaks located at 13.0 and 27.4 assign well with the (1 0 0) and (0 0 2) planes of g-C 3 N 4 , respectively 32.In Fig. 1c, two obvious diffraction peaks at 23 and 47 correspond to the (0 1 0) and (0 2 0) planes of W 18 O 49 (JCPDS 71-2450).In Fig. 1d, it can be clearly seen the sharp peaks of W 18 O 49 with (0 1 0) and (0 2 0) planes, while the characteristic peak of g-C 3 N 4 is not obvious.This phenomenon might be ascribed to the low crystallinity and percentage of g-C 3 N 4 . XPS was used to further characterize the composition and valence state of the elements of the materials.The photocatalytic performances of the as-prepared materials were evaluated through photocatalytic CO 2 reduction in the presence of H 2 O vapor under 300 W xenon lamp light irradiation.The photoreduction activity and the production rates of the materials are shown in Fig. 3a-3b.After irradiation for 4 h, it was found the CH 4 yield of the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite was about 1.38 mol g -1 h -1 , which is higher than that of g-C 3 N 4 (0.17mol g -1 h -1 ) and W 18 O 49 (0.12 mol g - 1 h -1 ).And the CH 4 yield is higher than that of the previously reported Cu-W 18 O 49 (0.67 mol g -1 h -1 ) 35, g-C 3 N 4 -Pt (0.3 mol g -1 h -1 ) 36, and Cu 2 O/TiO 2 (0.16 mol g -1 h -1 ) 37.As shown in Fig. 3b, the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite also exhibits much more CO production (0.92 mol g -1 h -1 ) than that of g-C 3 N 4 (0.046 mol g -1 h -1 ) and W 18 O 49 (0.032 mol g -1 h -1 ).As a matter of fact, the separation of photoinduced electron-hole pairs contributes to the enhancement of CO 2 photoreduction 38,39.The charge separation-recombination of the g-C 3 N 4 , W 18 O 49 , and g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite was also studied by photocurrent and EIS measurement.As shown in Fig. 3c, the photocurrent intensity of the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 is the strongest among the three materials, indicating that more efficient electron-hole separation takes place on the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite.As displayed in Fig. 3d, the g-C 3 N 4 -W 18 O 49 nanocomposite has the smallest semicircle radius, suggesting its fast interfacial charge transfer characteristics. On the basis of UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra in Fig. 4a, the band gap values of the prepared g-C 3 N 4 and W 18 O 49 were calculated according to the Kubelka-Munk function to be 2.74 and 2.65 eV, respectively.At the same time, the valence bands of g-C 3 N 4 and W 18 O 49 were 1.85 and 2.54 eV, respectively, as shown in VB XPS patterns in Fig. 4a and4d.Then, it can get the relative position of the bottom of the conduction band (calculated from E VB -Eg) and the VB of g-C 3 N 4 and W 18 O 49 sample (Fig. 4e).As shown in Fig. 4f, a Z-scheme heterojunction will be formed when the g-C 3 N 4 and W 18 O 49 come into contact with each other under light irradiation.The established internal electric field would allow the electrons in CB of W 18 O 49 to migrate to recombination with the holes in VB of g-C 3 N 4 .This electron-hole transfer path way could promote the separation and migration of photoinduced charge carriers.Accordingly, the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction into CH 4 and CO is enhanced due to the purification of more photogenerated electrons into the photoreduction process.
